title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)
description: There is a slight prickle that gives a surprise lift to this dry wine. Along with that is crisp fruit (lemon and apple flavors) and a refreshing amount of acidity. Drink now.

title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 Blue White (Vinho Verde)
description: This blend of Trajadura and Alvarinho comes from the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is cool and perfumed with apricot as well as creamed pear flavors. Drink the wine now.

title: Vinihold 2016 Caiua a Noite White (Vinho Verde)
description: Light, bright and fruity this is an easy-to-drink off-dry wine for the summer. It is clean and crisp, apples and pears set off by floral aromas. Drink now.

title: The Great Oregon Wine Company NV Rosé (Oregon)
description: This nonvintage rosé comes packaged in 187ml cans, with four to a pack. Lightly sugary flavors of simple strawberry fruit recall inexpensive California brands—except with a slightly tinny finish.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)
description: Part of a range of wines that showcases the different styles of Portugal's regions, This wine is smooth, creamily textured and with a warm ripe character. It has pineapple and mango as well as crisper lemon flavors to give a rich wine that is still poised and finely balanced. Drink now.

title: Yamhill Valley 2016 Rosé of Pinots Pinot Blanc-Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This unusual rosé is a cofermentation of 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Pinot Blanc. It's an uneasy compromise, with neither grape really taking the lead. Kind of like one of those awkward wine and food combos where the whole is less than either of its parts. Sour strawberry flavors thin out quickly; that's about it.

title: Las Palmeras 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)
description: Deep, dark espresso bean, loam and graphite aromas hide any sense of fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers more ripeness, in the form of black cherry, with an added kick of graphite, but the overall impression is quite simple.

title: François Lurton 2015 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Briary berry and cassis aromas are spicy and solid. In the mouth, this Carmenère is raw and tartaric in feel. Salty plum, coffee and herbal green flavors finish about the same, with a note of cured meat and residual acidic tang.

title: Fullerton 2015 Three Otters Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a serviceable, if nondescript Chardonnay. In a highly competitive category it doesn't stand out in any way. It's just a light expression of apple flavors, with a quick finish that leaves a slight impression of glue.

title: Gamache 2013 Estate Grown Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Barrel aromas are in the lead here, with notes of sawdust and cedar, along with Band Aid and gamy notes. Dark fruit aromas are in the background. The full-bodied flavors reveal more of the same, showing a lot of heat.

title: Hilanda 2014 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: A tidal wave of oak-derived aromas, mostly maple and milk chocolate, engulfs the nose of this Monastrell. On the palate, it's creamy yet wiry, its oaky mint and vanilla flavors blending with acidic tastes of currant and red plum before settling into an oaky, scouring finish.

title: Indomita 2016 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Aromas of citrus fruits, green herbs, grass and celery set up a shear lean palate with little body and pointed acidity. Tart lemon-lime flavors are crisp and scouring on the finish.

title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoke and baked plum notes provide flavor within this wine's easygoing structure and approachability.

title: Château Vermont 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: A pale-colored wine with crisp, tight red-currant fruit, this is light and lively. Drink this simple, attractive wine now.

title: Camina 2016 Verdejo Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: Light, clean apple aromas lead to a basic palate with skin-driven texture. Airy green fruit and citrus peel flavors finish mild and fresh. At 11.5% abv, this is about as light as good wine gets.

title: Casca Wines NV Cascas White (Vinho Verde)
description: A blend of Loureiro, Arinto and Avesso, this light and fruity wine has an edge of prickle along with great acidity and citrus flavors. It is a great summer food wine. Drink now.

title: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This is a soft wine, lightly creamy and with simple red fruit, citrus fruits and acidity to match. It is an easygoing fruity wine that is ready to drink.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Tinto Red (Lisboa)
description: The wine, named after a typical mustache from the 19th century, is all fruit: ripe blackberries with balancing acidity. This is an easy ripe wine that will be great with barbecues this summer thanks to its soft tannins and drinkability.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)
description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, this is a smoothly ripe wine. Its cherry and spice flavors are given just a hint of structure built by a tannic edge. This soft juicy wine is ready to drink.

title: Château de Parenchère 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: With plenty of citrus flavors, this wine is fruity while also tight and mineral textured. At this stage, it is all about acidity, so it needs to age for a few months. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château La Gabarre 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A rounded and soft wine, this is already open and ready to drink. It has a full-bodied character although without great fruitiness. The aftertaste is gentle and smooth.

title: Château Pierrail 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is tight and young. It will have crisp citrus acidity as it matures, giving a bright, lively wine, refreshing to drink and just right for food.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Colheita White (Alentejo)
description: The wine is all tangy zesty fruit. With plenty of apple and grapefruit acidity, it is lively, textured and bright. Drink now.

title: Adega Mãe 2016 Pinta Negra White (Lisboa)
description: This is an attractive fruity wine. With its soft texture, perfumed white fruits and balanced acidity, it is the sort of wine that is ready for a warm day. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Pregón Verdejo Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Green herb aromas are up front on this wine's slightly stale nose. Its plump melon flavors are short on zing, tasting dry and yeasty with a low-acid finish.

title: Sanguinhal 2014 Peninsula de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)
description: The wine is full of the taste of superripe fruit. That gives a juicy character as well as the softest tannins. It is ready to drink.

title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Anjos de Portugal White (Vinho Verde)
description: An off-dry lightly fizzy Vinho Verde, this is crisp, clean and fruity. With its citrus kick, it needs to be drunk this summer.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This stainless steel-fermented wine opens with white flower scents and grassy, herbaceous notes, following up with tart lemon and melon on the palate.

title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2016 Twice Removed Venturi Vineyard Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: Simple flavors and a soft texture don't give much personality to this light-bodied wine, but it's clean and fresh. It has a light salmon color, raspberry aromas and rather neutral flavors.

title: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Chinuri (Georgia)
description: Honey gold in color, this wine made from an indigenous Georgian grape has a bouquet of white cherries and lavender. Tart flavors of honeydew melon and white plum persist into the soft floral finish.
